summary.long: Philemon is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother,
To our beloved coworker Philemon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to our sister Apphia, to our fellow soldier Archippus, and to the church in your house:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God always when I mention you in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I hear of your love for all the saints and your faith toward the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that the partnership of your faith may become effective as you comprehend all the good that we share in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have indeed received much joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, my brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, though I am more than bold enough in Christ to command you to do the right thing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet I would rather appeal to you on the basis of love—and I, Paul, do this as an old man and now also as a prisoner of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am appealing to you for my child, Onesimus, whose father I have become during my imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful to you and to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sending him, that is, my own heart, back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wanted to keep him with me so that he might minister to me in your place during my imprisonment for the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I preferred to do nothing without your consent in order that your good deed might be voluntary and not something forced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps this is the reason he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back for the long term,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no longer as a slave but more than a slave, a beloved brother—especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you consider me your partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge that to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will repay it. I say nothing about your owing me even your own self.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, brother, let me have this benefit from you in the Lord! Refresh my heart in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One thing more: prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping through your prayers to be restored to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my coworkers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
